summary: Lie With Me (Sit Down Part II)
title: Lie With Me (Sit Down Part II)
body:
Hello!! I’m a little in shock at how much people loved Sit Down, and I know a few people asked for a part 2, SO I DID! I have to say a massive thank you to @pendantstyles for sharing my original post, Hannah is incredible and I love her ❤️ please let me know if you like it!!!!!!!

~~~

You actually can’t remember the last time you felt so… floaty? It’s been just over a week since Harry apologised to you that Monday night in the kitchen after an argument over a bowl of soup, and he’s acting weirder than ever now. You still weren’t entirely yourself, and you hate to blame other people but you have to hold Harry partly responsible for your glumness.

Your relationship had gone from one extreme to the other; instead of being completely ignored and barely seeing him, he now absolutely would not leave you alone. He was working himself around you now, doing his best to be by your side at every opportunity. 

Sure, it was nice on days one and two, feeling like you finally had your fiancé back after an impossible amount of time and actually starting to feel loved again. He’s there in the morning when you get up, he takes you to work and making desperately sure to give you a kiss before you get out of his car. And then he’s there when you finish to take you home again, always wearing a ridiculous smile that does make you laugh because he is just a bit ridiculous, isn’t he?

For the first time in months Harry actually holds you as you sleep, his arms permanently wrapped around your middle the entire night. You’re quite wriggly in bed, always have been and undoubtedly always will be, and he’s even ignored that because he’s absolutely damned if you’re going anywhere.

You’d actually been reminded of an advert you’d seen on the telly recently; your mattress is getting old and your relationship is growing tired. You’re separating emotionally and also physically which must mean it’s time for a new mattress. You get your new mattress and miraculously your love for one another has re-blossomed. Except on this occasion you still have that same mattress and your fiancé has actually just stopped being a twat. For now anyway.

The problem was you didn’t want Harry to be at your side every single minute of every single day. You just wanted it to go back to normal, how it had been when you got engaged. You were both incapable of being subtle about your feelings for one another but at the same time what you were doing together felt natural. Now everything feels forced, and you feel - and you really, really hate to admit it - suffocated.

Harry’s constant attention is pulling your mind from itself, it was like you were watching yourself from another person’s eyes. Like you were in subspace without the sex part. Like you were having an out of body experience. You just still weren’t you.

You had no idea of Harry’s concerns for you. He’d paid attention to everything you did. He noticed the moment you got home you crashed on the sofa rather than immediately making dinner. Noticed the bags under your eyes from your exhaustion, and noticed your resignation from any task your were encumbered with.

Of the eight nights he’s been secretly observing you, four of those you’ve had a drink before bed. Two of them had been on days when you didn’t have to work the next day, and the other two you’d come home in a foul mood after a shit day. You’d made love each of those four nights, and you don’t like to brag but… damn.

Much to your confusion he’d visited your mum’s with you that week. You’d always go on a Sunday evening because she always seems to have plans literally every other day of the week. Harry didn’t usually come with you, but for reasons unbeknownst to you he did this week, and your mum was over the moon.

“Oh!” She’d beamed between the both of you in absolute delight. “Let’s open a bottle since Harry’s finally decided to show his face again!” It hadn’t been a dig at Harry, more a notion that he never accompanied you on your weekly visit and it was nice to see his face again.

You failed to notice the relief wash over Harry’s face at your decline to her offer of a drink. Why would you think anything of it anyway? You’re not one to indulge your mother’s ignorance towards her very obvious problem.

Up to this point you hadn’t actually had a drink for three or four days. You’d adopted a migraine a few days back just after you’d visited your mum and had really been feeling it ever since. It no doubt developed after you’d neglected to wear your glasses for all of about ten minutes at work, and you were really being punished for your stupidity.

The throbbing behind your eyes had begun to cause temporary blind spots in your vision, and for the first time in a week you were grateful for Harry’s ongoing chauffeur service.

As you stand waiting for him by the back door of your work where he usually collects you, you don’t notice the fact that you’re all but glaring at the floor, frowning and squinting your eyes to try and relieve the pain. It’s too bright outside; you can barely handle keeping your eyes open even a fraction because the sun is far too shiny for your liking today.

Because you’re too busy insulting the pavement underneath you just with your face, you fail to notice Harry pull up mere inches in front of you. The fact that you’re spending too much time thinking about how much your head hurts is only making it hurt more, and now you’re just feeling pitiful at yourself.

Harry calling your name pulls you from your bubble of grumpiness, and your head snaps up to see his car literally right there in front of you. You can’t quite believe that you actually managed to miss the huge thing approach you, and you internally scold yourself for being so fucking dramatic.

You blink at him wide eyed a couple of times and scramble into the passenger seat blindly, the white spots in your vision seemingly merging into one so that you really can’t see much at all.

Harry’s watching you awkwardly blink ahead of you as you pull your seatbelt on, and at first he finds it slightly amusing. But when you don’t say anything at all and fall sideways so that your head is resting on the window, and your hand covers your eyes to block any further light getting in, he’s concerned again. “You alright, love?”

“Uh uh.” You mumble with a very gentle shake of your head. You’re scared that talking might aggravate the throbbing further.

“What’s the matter?” Harry’s throat is thick and tight, and he’s now put the car into neutral so that he can angle himself towards you properly. He can see you’re not well just from the even darker circles under your eyes and the fact that you’re much, much paler in complexion than usual.

You take a deep breath, the pain in your head spiking from his words even though they were softer than you think you’ve ever heard him speak. “Head hurts.” You whisper, and it’s almost a whimper because you feel your cries threatening in your chest and your tears burning your eyes.

You’ve been with Harry long enough for him to know that your migraines are common, but he’s never seen one as bad as this. “Okay,” he breathes slowly, his releasing breath a little shaky with his concern for you, “let’s get you home and to bed.” He takes your hand in his and brings it to his lips. He holds it the entire way home, only releasing it to change gear or indicate.

Regardless of your feelings of suffocation, you can’t deny that you’re grateful that Harry is still here and with you. You can’t imagine doing this with anyone else. As much as you’ve argued you’re glad that it’s him you’re arguing with. As much as you’ve struggled you’re glad that it’s him you’re struggling with. Relationships are not just a walk in the park.

Harry throws you cautious glances every so often, but you never see them because your eyes remain closed until he’s pulled onto the driveway. He’s careful with you, helping you out of the car slowly since your sight is still temporarily… well, blank. He opens the door for you, and all but carries you upstairs to bed as his hands are holding your waist to make sure you don’t fall.

You strip out your work clothes slowly, still frowning mostly at the floor as you do so. You pull on a t-shirt that Harry had left draped over the back of the chair as he gets you a glass of water. You’ve drank more than enough water today but you still feel dehydrated and had no trouble downing the entire pint in less than a minute.

“Good girl.” Harry mumbles his praise quietly, and places a soft kiss to your forehead before disappearing to replace it.

When he returns you’re already settled under the covers but your arms are crossed over your eyes to avoid the light flooding the room. Harry makes it his next task to cover the windows to block out the harsh sunlight, not even leaving a lamp on just in case.

“Go to sleep, angel.” He whispers to you, his hand caressing your stomach under your t-shirt as he leans down to place an ever so gentle kiss to your lips. “I’ll just be downstairs if you need me, alright?”

You frown at his words and at the fact that he’s already making a move for the door. You don’t want him to leave you. Not yet anyway. “Wait,” you sit up and call after him, though the sound is quiet as a mouse, “can you just… can y’just lie with me a minute?”

Harry turns back to you with a small smile, but even through your partial vision you can see in his eyes that he’s elated you’ve asked him. “Course I can, love.” He hums, and soon enough he’s crawling into bed beside you, tucking you into his side and nuzzling his nose into your hair.

This is the closest you’ve felt to him for the longest time, all the tension the two of you have had seems to disappear, because right in this moment all that matters is that he cares about you and you care about him.

You’re not sure whether it’s your migraine, Harry’s intoxicating smell or your exhaustion, but it only takes a matter of minutes for sleep to consume you, and you’re finally slipping into the far corners of your dreams.

¬

It’s dark when you wake again. You’re not sure of the time, but Harry is still holding you except he’s moved you to lie between his legs. The tv is on and at its lowest possible volume, and you can tell that Harry’s adjusted the brightness on it because it’s usually a lot brighter than that.

You shift your position ever so slightly, and you feel Harry’s arms tighten around you. You focus on the tv to adjust your vision, sitting up slowly and rubbing your eyes. Your migraine appears to have settled, though maybe not entirely as you can still feel a gentle ache in your left temple. At least you can fucking see now though, right?

“Feeling better?” Harry asks quietly, his hand moving up to the side of your face to stroke your cheek. He’d told you once your cheeks were magnificent, you’ve never quite understood it.

You turn your head towards him and give him a small nod with a gentle smile. You notice that he looks extra pretty today. His curls are extra curly, and the warm light of the tv is giving him a sort of strange red hew. Even now his green eyes are piercing, and you hate how much you fucking love them. How much you fucking love him. You’ve told him before to stop being so pretty because it’s not fair on everyone else. What does he do in those circumstances? Laugh. Narcissist.

“I do,” your words catch in your throat from sleep, so you clear your voice before speaking again, “much better.”

Harry’s lips pull at the corners, and his eyes wrinkle at the beginnings of a smile. Any bigger and his dimples would threaten, and you’d burst into tears because they’re just so stupidly pretty all on their own. He reaches to the bedside table to hand you the water he’d left for you earlier, and once again its gone in no time at all. “Are you hungry?”

His question has you listening to your stomach. The honest answer was no; you weren’t hungry. But you knew Harry too well by this point that it was a rhetorical question and he was actually asking you what you want to eat. You didn’t know that either. “Um, not right now but I probably will be in like an hour.”

Your answer seems to pacify him, though you can already guess what his next words will be. “Hopefully by the time dinner’s ready you’ll be hungry then.” He raises his brows at you suggestively, smile widening to finally set those fucking dimples you’ve been desperate to avoid.

“Yeah maybe.” Is all you can fathom, and you frown at him in bewilderment but you’re basically smiling through it anyway.

You’re not that couple who dance and sing in the kitchen any more. You’re also not the couple who stare at each other longingly from across the room at public events. You’re not the couple who force your love for other people to see to prove a point, and you’re not the couple who have completely fallen out of love either.

No, you’re the couple that even after a tough time with one another managed to pull through and come out at the end of it still in love. Undeniably in love. You and Harry know that if you can survive a patch like you just have, you can probably survive the rest.

Relationships aren’t a walk in the park. They take hard work, communication and effort. You and Harry might just feel like you’ve finally found your balance to make yours work, and that’s really all either of you can ask for.

~~~

Cheers!

You failed to notice the relief wash over Harry’s face at your decline to her offer of a drink. Why would you think anything of it anyway? You’re not one to indulge your mother’s ignorance towards her very obvious problem.

Up to this point you hadn’t actually had a drink for three or four days. You’d adopted a migraine a few days back just after you’d visited your mum and had really been feeling it ever since. It no doubt developed after you’d neglected to wear your glasses for all of about ten minutes at work, and you were really being punished for your stupidity.

The throbbing behind your eyes had begun to cause temporary blind spots in your vision, and for the first time in a week you were grateful for Harry’s ongoing chauffeur service.

As you stand waiting for him by the back door of your work where he usually collects you, you don’t notice the fact that you’re all but glaring at the floor, frowning and squinting your eyes to try and relieve the pain. It’s too bright outside; you can barely handle keeping your eyes open even a fraction because the sun is far too shiny for your liking today.

Because you’re too busy insulting the pavement underneath you just with your face, you fail to notice Harry pull up mere inches in front of you. The fact that you’re spending too much time thinking about how much your head hurts is only making it hurt more, and now you’re just feeling pitiful at yourself.

Harry calling your name pulls you from your bubble of grumpiness, and your head snaps up to see his car literally right there in front of you. You can’t quite believe that you actually managed to miss the huge thing approach you, and you internally scold yourself for being so fucking dramatic.

You blink at him wide eyed a couple of times and scramble into the passenger seat blindly, the white spots in your vision seemingly merging into one so that you really can’t see much at all.

Harry’s watching you awkwardly blink ahead of you as you pull your seatbelt on, and at first he finds it slightly amusing. But when you don’t say anything at all and fall sideways so that your head is resting on the window, and your hand covers your eyes to block any further light getting in, he’s concerned again. “You alright, love?”

“Uh uh.” You mumble with a very gentle shake of your head. You’re scared that talking might aggravate the throbbing further.

“What’s the matter?” Harry’s throat is thick and tight, and he’s now put the car into neutral so that he can angle himself towards you properly. He can see you’re not well just from the even darker circles under your eyes and the fact that you’re much, much paler in complexion than usual.

You take a deep breath, the pain in your head spiking from his words even though they were softer than you think you’ve ever heard him speak. “Head hurts.” You whisper, and it’s almost a whimper because you feel your cries threatening in your chest and your tears burning your eyes.

You’ve been with Harry long enough for him to know that your migraines are common, but he’s never seen one as bad as this. “Okay,” he breathes slowly, his releasing breath a little shaky with his concern for you, “let’s get you home and to bed.” He takes your hand in his and brings it to his lips. He holds it the entire way home, only releasing it to change gear or indicate.

Regardless of your feelings of suffocation, you can’t deny that you’re grateful that Harry is still here and with you. You can’t imagine doing this with anyone else. As much as you’ve argued you’re glad that it’s him you’re arguing with. As much as you’ve struggled you’re glad that it’s him you’re struggling with. Relationships are not just a walk in the park.

Harry throws you cautious glances every so often, but you never see them because your eyes remain closed until he’s pulled onto the driveway. He’s careful with you, helping you out of the car slowly since your sight is still temporarily… well, blank. He opens the door for you, and all but carries you upstairs to bed as his hands are holding your waist to make sure you don’t fall.

You strip out your work clothes slowly, still frowning mostly at the floor as you do so. You pull on a t-shirt that Harry had left draped over the back of the chair as he gets you a glass of water. You’ve drank more than enough water today but you still feel dehydrated and had no trouble downing the entire pint in less than a minute.

“Good girl.” Harry mumbles his praise quietly, and places a soft kiss to your forehead before disappearing to replace it.

When he returns you’re already settled under the covers but your arms are crossed over your eyes to avoid the light flooding the room. Harry makes it his next task to cover the windows to block out the harsh sunlight, not even leaving a lamp on just in case.

“Go to sleep, angel.” He whispers to you, his hand caressing your stomach under your t-shirt as he leans down to place an ever so gentle kiss to your lips. “I’ll just be downstairs if you need me, alright?”

You frown at his words and at the fact that he’s already making a move for the door. You don’t want him to leave you. Not yet anyway. “Wait,” you sit up and call after him, though the sound is quiet as a mouse, “can you just… can y’just lie with me a minute?”

Harry turns back to you with a small smile, but even through your partial vision you can see in his eyes that he’s elated you’ve asked him. “Course I can, love.” He hums, and soon enough he’s crawling into bed beside you, tucking you into his side and nuzzling his nose into your hair.

This is the closest you’ve felt to him for the longest time, all the tension the two of you have had seems to disappear, because right in this moment all that matters is that he cares about you and you care about him.

You’re not sure whether it’s your migraine, Harry’s intoxicating smell or your exhaustion, but it only takes a matter of minutes for sleep to consume you, and you’re finally slipping into the far corners of your dreams.

¬

It’s dark when you wake again. You’re not sure of the time, but Harry is still holding you except he’s moved you to lie between his legs. The tv is on and at its lowest possible volume, and you can tell that Harry’s adjusted the brightness on it because it’s usually a lot brighter than that.

You shift your position ever so slightly, and you feel Harry’s arms tighten around you. You focus on the tv to adjust your vision, sitting up slowly and rubbing your eyes. Your migraine appears to have settled, though maybe not entirely as you can still feel a gentle ache in your left temple. At least you can fucking see now though, right?

“Feeling better?” Harry asks quietly, his hand moving up to the side of your face to stroke your cheek. He’d told you once your cheeks were magnificent, you’ve never quite understood it.

You turn your head towards him and give him a small nod with a gentle smile. You notice that he looks extra pretty today. His curls are extra curly, and the warm light of the tv is giving him a sort of strange red hew. Even now his green eyes are piercing, and you hate how much you fucking love them. How much you fucking love him. You’ve told him before to stop being so pretty because it’s not fair on everyone else. What does he do in those circumstances? Laugh. Narcissist.

“I do,” your words catch in your throat from sleep, so you clear your voice before speaking again, “much better.”

Harry’s lips pull at the corners, and his eyes wrinkle at the beginnings of a smile. Any bigger and his dimples would threaten, and you’d burst into tears because they’re just so stupidly pretty all on their own. He reaches to the bedside table to hand you the water he’d left for you earlier, and once again its gone in no time at all. “Are you hungry?”

His question has you listening to your stomach. The honest answer was no; you weren’t hungry. But you knew Harry too well by this point that it was a rhetorical question and he was actually asking you what you want to eat. You didn’t know that either. “Um, not right now but I probably will be in like an hour.”

Your answer seems to pacify him, though you can already guess what his next words will be. “Hopefully by the time dinner’s ready you’ll be hungry then.” He raises his brows at you suggestively, smile widening to finally set those fucking dimples you’ve been desperate to avoid.

“Yeah maybe.” Is all you can fathom, and you frown at him in bewilderment but you’re basically smiling through it anyway.

You’re not that couple who dance and sing in the kitchen any more. You’re also not the couple who stare at each other longingly from across the room at public events. You’re not the couple who force your love for other people to see to prove a point, and you’re not the couple who have completely fallen out of love either.

No, you’re the couple that even after a tough time with one another managed to pull through and come out at the end of it still in love. Undeniably in love. You and Harry know that if you can survive a patch like you just have, you can probably survive the rest.

Relationships aren’t a walk in the park. They take hard work, communication and effort. You and Harry might just feel like you’ve finally found your balance to make yours work, and that’s really all either of you can ask for.

~~~

Cheers!

You’d actually been reminded of an advert you’d seen on the telly recently; your mattress is getting old and your relationship is growing tired. You’re separating emotionally and also physically which must mean it’s time for a new mattress. You get your new mattress and miraculously your love for one another has re-blossomed. Except on this occasion you still have that same mattress and your fiancé has actually just stopped being a twat. For now anyway.

You were both incapable of being subtle about your feelings for one another but at the same time what you were doing together felt natural. summary: I Thought You Loved Me Y/N overhears one of Harry's conversations and confronts him . . . ⚠️Warnings⚠️ angst You check your...
body:
I Thought You Loved Me

Y/N overhears one of Harry’s conversations and confronts him …

⚠️Warnings⚠️ angst

You check your outfit nervously, brimming with excitement as you stand outside the door of your boyfriend Harry’s dressing room. He’s on tour at the moment and you’ve been missing him like crazy! So you decided to surprise him with a visit. Now here you were, just a slightly ajar door between you. Obviously, he had no clue you’re even in the same country as him, which is probably why he’s having the conversation that he’s having with Mitch.

You’re about to open the door when you hear a sentence that makes you stop in your tracks. “God man, does Y/N know?” asks Mitch. Harry seems shocked. “Fuckin’ hell no! She’d kill me!” You hitch in a breath, waiting to find out what exactly it is that they’re talking about. You hear Mitch chuckle, and your grip on the doorknob tightens. “You know I like Y/N, but you shouldn’t be so tied down! You’re a rockstar! Go find some more models or something, and have a bit of fun! It’s gotta be better than sitting here pining away for a girl who isn’t even that great looking!” You’ve always been aware of the fact that you were not as pretty as some of his exes, but you truly thought he loved you. But surely, he would tell Mitch to stop, say he loved you and would never dream of cheating?

That’s not what happened.

Harry sighs. “Ya know that with Celaena and Amelia it was different! Ya know it was just a one night thing!” You bite down in your lip to keep from crying out. Tears begin to side down your cheeks as your worst fears come to life. Mitch scoffs. “Your know, at some point the paps will catch on, and Y/N will find out about the string of models you leave behind in hotel rooms. Then you’ll be screwed. Just break up with her man!” You somehow know that Harry has a naughty smile on his face. You can just tell. “Maybe I will, ya know? It’s harmless just a few uh, friends!” You hear Mitch snort, and cackle. “Hey I dunno about you man, but I don’t go around fucking my friends!”

That’s when you can’t hold it in any longer, and a sob escaped from you. You hear a small fuck from Harry and he strides towards the door, yanking it open. “Y/N,I can explain-” you cut him off, screaming “I THOUGHT YOU LOVED ME! I THOUGHT WE WERE HAPPY! AND YOU’VE BEEN LYING TO MY FACE, FUCKING MODELS? I’M SORRY I’M NOT BEAUTIFUL, I’M SORRY I’M NOT SEXY BUT AREN’T I ENOUGH FOR YOU?” Harry’s eyes fill with tears and he tries desperately to think of an excuse, any way to make it seem innocent. But he has no time to come up with anything, because a stage hand begins leading him to the stage. “Two minutes, Mr. Styles!” He turns to look at you. “Please Y/N, stay till after the show! You shake your head, on the verge of collapsing. Everything you thought you had, was dispersing beneath your fingertips and you were powerless to stop it. "No I can’t stay Harry, wouldn’t want to get in the way of your models!” And with that you stumble out of the building, and walk away from the man you loved, the man who cheated on you.

But surely, he would tell Mitch to stop, say he loved you and would never dream of cheating?

That’s not what happened.

Harry sighs. “Ya know that with Celaena and Amelia it was different! Ya know it was just a one night thing!” You bite down in your lip to keep from crying out. Mitch scoffs. “Your know, at some point the paps will catch on, and Y/N will find out about the string of models you leave behind in hotel rooms. Then you’ll be screwed. summary: Grey Area - Chapter 7
title: Grey Area - Chapter 7
body:
A/N: tee hee did I just post two chapters in the span of 10 minutes?


Vanilla is hands down Monica’s favourite scent.

She smiles to herself as she spreads it along her skin, the tepid water gently pelting at her from the shower. It’s so hot outside; she thought she’d be a puddle if she reached home a minute later.

She feels much better than before when she’s out of the shower, wrapped up in her bath robe and her left open.  Humming a song to herself, she changes into an old tee and a worn over pair of shorts, that had become softer with its overuse.

She looks at her phone, a hollow feeling occupying her stomach at the memory she recalls. The helpline she works at provided her with a phone. A man, Mason Walters, had called from the hospital, after a suicide attempt - he’d downed the cleaning beach to almost half the can. He spewed curse after curse at Monica, and she took all of it.

She knew they were directed at his life, not at her.

Monica did what she could. She talked about life. That life was about trying, not giving up; we are all born for a purpose, aren’t we? Everybody has dark times. Some have it longer and harder than others, but they all pass. It’s in these times when our hard work, strength, and patience matter.

That is when people when know you a s a strong person, and will respect you for that.

Mason hung up without saying anything. This is what scares Monica – she doesn’t know if they’re going to do it again. His name is put up on her daily to – do board, in neon green paper.

She sighs as the events replay in her mind, lying down on her bed and switching the lights off and goes through her voicemails on her personal phone. She’s just about to lock her phone when a text from Harry arrives.

Are you awake? I tried calling you since the past hour and you’re not answering the phone. –H.

She face-palms herself, cursing at her forgetfulness. She realized that her personal phone was on silent during work and she forgot to turn it off when she got home. There were six missed calls from him, which had Monica dialing his number quickly.

“H-“

“I’m so sorry I didn’t answer your calls. I was, well, on my other phone. The one from the community. This guy, Mason, ended up drinking half a can of the cleaning bleach and called after he’d been operated by the doctors,” she said at once, pausing to take a breath.  “Do you see how – “

“Are you even breathing? Calm down,” Harry says, laughing.

Monica found herself smiling too. “I’m sorry,” she sighs tiredly, closing her eyes and letting the exhaustion take over. “He was, just, really mad at life and he kind of took it all out on me, so… I am just peachy, I guess. Why did you want to call?”

Harry gnawed on his bottom lip, forcing himself to speak, “It’s – um – it’s about… Avery.”

There was a short pause on the other end. She took a steady breath before replying. “Okay. I’m listening”.

Those words were enough to calm him. She’s listening.”It’s her birthday, today,” he says, his fingers tracing small circles on the couch’s arm.

“Oh,” Monica flips onto her stomach. “She’d be twenty five, right? ”

“Yeah…” he trails off, fingers jabbing a little harder on the couch arm. “I um – visited the cemetery, earlier.” He sighs out. The very subject of Avery weighs down upon his shoulders like a bag of bricks. He has never been able to get over her. Even if he tried to, some memory of them would come wafting into his brain and he’ll pull himself back again. Sure, the wounds on his heart burn less, but they don’t hesitate to bleed afresh whenever those blue eyes appear in his dreams.

He is still functioning like a robot, having lost all will to do anything. He just wakes up every day to go work so that he can pay his bills.

“Did… Avery, talk to you frequently?” he asks.

“Yeah, at least four times a week. We talked a lot. Why?”

“She never mentioned that she was going to kill herself? Or was, trying to?”

Monica frowned, sitting up on the bed. “No, Harry. On the contrary, I was pretty shocked when I came to know about the incident. It’s astonishing how she did not let me get a hint of what she was feeling. I was… stumped, when I heard.”

Harry’s brows furrow, reminiscing how broken she looked during her last days. “She was pretty evasive during that time,” his voice wavering a little.

“Harry, you don’t have to tell me right aw – “

“I caught her in the kitchen with a knife one day,” he says in one breath. Monica’s eyes widen in shock. “I just came back home from work, only to find her with that huge knife in her hand. She did not even look sad or scared. She looked focused; determined, even.” Harry’s voice becomes tight with emotion, him trying to gulp down the uneasy feeling spreading in his body at the grim memory.

“Babe?”

The knife dropped from her hand, Avery jumped and yelping lightly in fright. She had her back towards him, clutching her chest to calm down the sudden and sporadic heartbeat.

Harry was still taking everything in; he did not quite register the scene in front of him. This was not something he wanted to come home to tonight.

On the way here, he thought it would be a good idea to order Chinese from the local restaurant for dinner and later they’d share a bath. He had been worrying constantly about her schizophrenia over the past few weeks. Also, his job was the cherry on top of the cake for him.

A nice, relaxing time would be good for them, even if it lasts for a little bit.

So, surely, Harry was pretty much bowled over at the sight in front of him. If he’d arrived a minute later, God knew what he’d do and the thought was churning his stomach.

“What are you doing?” he says, his feet remain cemented on to the floor, not moving a single muscle since he arrived at the doorway of his house.

He looks at her face, which showed an expression of disdain. She looked annoyed and angry, frustrated even. His gaze shifts to the shiny blade peeking from the side of the counter, lying on the floor.

“Oh my – ,” Harry chokes on his words, everything clicking together in his brain.

“She even had the nerve to pick it up and try again,” he says. Her pained and desperate voice rings in Harry’s ears, yelling at him to let her kill herself and struggling to get out of his tight grip around her with  him trying his best to retract the knife from her hand.  

“I just couldn’t understand what was happening to her,” he says, his voice cracking between sobs. His face was red, a few tears trickling down his face. “What hurt her so bad that she even thought of killing herself? Wasn’t I enough? Weren’t all her friends and family enough?” He runs a hand through his face and hair, blowing out a gust of wind from his mouth, trying to calm himself. He shuts his eyes tiredly as he says, “Why would anybody want to do that to themselves?”

“Hey, hey,” Monica says. “Don’t blame yourself for what she did. Nobody should be blamed.”

“Of course someone, or, something, is to blame!” Harry exclaims in anger. “Do you think a person will voluntarily kill themselves? Was she in a mood that told her to kill herself?!” Harry is panting by the end of the sentence, now sitting upright on the couch.

“I did not mean to sound like that, Harry,” Monica sighs. Harry has gone past whatever he’s been restraining himself from. He was at his breaking point. Monica cannot imagine what it must have been like for him – to watch the person you love slowly die from within and then entirely.

“Look,” Monica tries again when all she hears are harsh breaths on the other end. “There must be something - if not someone - that must have motivated her. Can you think of any bad incident that happened to her?”

Harry has his head cradled in his palm, the other clutching his phone. He shakes his head, “No, not that I can think of. We’ve had our silly tiffs, had bad days at work. That’s it.”

“Oh,” Monica says, disappointed. “Well… I’m sorry, Harry.” She is genuinely sad for Harry. He is blaming himself for an incident that he is not responsible for.

When she doesn’t hear him for the next minute or two, she speaks up, “Hey, it’s – um - almost two in the morning… and tomorrow’s a Sunday!” she exclaims in realization. “Maybe, we can… meet up?”

Harry looks at the clock at her words, fingers wiping away the traces of his tears. “Uh, okay. Park?”

“The park it is, at ten? ” Monica smiles. Her voice shifts onto a more serious tone, “I know you’re really shaken up now, Harry. Don’t do anything stupid; Niall will report to me.”

“Ten is fine.” Harry says and hangs up.

He doesn’t know what just happened to him. Revisiting all those old memories had opened those wounds and dark chambers in his mind; her voice, her eyes, her tears, everything appearing before his eyes and a blurred image forms; messing with his lucidity.

And he hates the unbearable heartache that comes with it.

He looks at his phone and Monica’s words ring in his head: Don’t do anything stupid. They keep on blaring in his head, and his conscience fights to maintain its composure. A bottle of Jack Daniels awaits him on the counter, the amber colour luring him in.

Don’t do anything stupid.

He shakes his head as if to dismiss the voice, and grabs the bottle swiftly. The burning in his throat as he chugs down the liquid tells him that he is going to be okay, in a matter of time.

He’d stumbled into her apartment – Amanda was her name, was it? – half an hour later. She said she had been waiting for him, and easily welcomed him home, and into her body. He didn’t care about anything at that moment. He looked into her blue eyes and his throat choked up; he moved his head to her shoulders as he guided his body in and out of her. It was fast, messy, and empty.

When everything’s over and April is fast asleep beside him, he lays on her bed wide awake. The sickening feeling returns in his stomach as he looks at her, and Monica’s words ring again.

Don’t do anything stupid.

Harry looks at the clock at her words, fingers wiping away the traces of his tears. “Uh, okay. Park?”

“The park it is, at ten? ” Monica smiles. Her voice shifts onto a more serious tone, “I know you’re really shaken up now, Harry. Don’t do anything stupid; Niall will report to me.”

“Ten is fine.” Harry says and hangs up.

He doesn’t know what just happened to him. Revisiting all those old memories had opened those wounds and dark chambers in his mind; her voice, her eyes, her tears, everything appearing before his eyes and a blurred image forms; messing with his lucidity.

And he hates the unbearable heartache that comes with it.

He looks at his phone and Monica’s words ring in his head: Don’t do anything stupid. They keep on blaring in his head, and his conscience fights to maintain its composure. A bottle of Jack Daniels awaits him on the counter, the amber colour luring him in.

Don’t do anything stupid.

He shakes his head as if to dismiss the voice, and grabs the bottle swiftly. The burning in his throat as he chugs down the liquid tells him that he is going to be okay, in a matter of time.

He’d stumbled into her apartment – Amanda was her name, was it? – half an hour later. She said she had been waiting for him, and easily welcomed him home, and into her body. He didn’t care about anything at that moment. He looked into her blue eyes and his throat choked up; he moved his head to her shoulders as he guided his body in and out of her. It was fast, messy, and empty.

When everything’s over and April is fast asleep beside him, he lays on her bed wide awake. The sickening feeling returns in his stomach as he looks at her, and Monica’s words ring again.

Don’t do anything stupid.

trail.content_raw:
A/N: tee hee did I just post two chapters in the span of 10 minutes?


Vanilla is hands down Monica’s favourite scent.

She smiles to herself as she spreads it along her skin, the tepid water gently pelting at her from the shower. It’s so hot outside; she thought she’d be a puddle if she reached home a minute later.

She feels much better than before when she’s out of the shower, wrapped up in her bath robe and her left open.  Humming a song to herself, she changes into an old tee and a worn over pair of shorts, that had become softer with its overuse.

She looks at her phone, a hollow feeling occupying her stomach at the memory she recalls. The helpline she works at provided her with a phone. A man, Mason Walters, had called from the hospital, after a suicide attempt - he’d downed the cleaning beach to almost half the can. He spewed curse after curse at Monica, and she took all of it.

She knew they were directed at his life, not at her.

Monica did what she could. She talked about life. That life was about trying, not giving up; we are all born for a purpose, aren’t we? Everybody has dark times. Some have it longer and harder than others, but they all pass. It’s in these times when our hard work, strength, and patience matter.

That is when people when know you a s a strong person, and will respect you for that.

Mason hung up without saying anything. This is what scares Monica – she doesn’t know if they’re going to do it again. His name is put up on her daily to – do board, in neon green paper.

She sighs as the events replay in her mind, lying down on her bed and switching the lights off and goes through her voicemails on her personal phone. She’s just about to lock her phone when a text from Harry arrives.

Are you awake? I tried calling you since the past hour and you’re not answering the phone. –H.

She face-palms herself, cursing at her forgetfulness. She realized that her personal phone was on silent during work and she forgot to turn it off when she got home. There were six missed calls from him, which had Monica dialing his number quickly.

“H-“

“I’m so sorry I didn’t answer your calls. I was, well, on my other phone. The one from the community. This guy, Mason, ended up drinking half a can of the cleaning bleach and called after he’d been operated by the doctors,” she said at once, pausing to take a breath.  “Do you see how – “

“Are you even breathing? Calm down,” Harry says, laughing.

Monica found herself smiling too. “I’m sorry,” she sighs tiredly, closing her eyes and letting the exhaustion take over. “He was, just, really mad at life and he kind of took it all out on me, so… I am just peachy, I guess. Why did you want to call?”

Harry gnawed on his bottom lip, forcing himself to speak, “It’s – um – it’s about… Avery.”

There was a short pause on the other end. She took a steady breath before replying. “Okay. I’m listening”.

Those words were enough to calm him. She’s listening.”It’s her birthday, today,” he says, his fingers tracing small circles on the couch’s arm.

“Oh,” Monica flips onto her stomach. “She’d be twenty five, right? ”

“Yeah…” he trails off, fingers jabbing a little harder on the couch arm. “I um – visited the cemetery, earlier.” He sighs out. The very subject of Avery weighs down upon his shoulders like a bag of bricks. He has never been able to get over her. Even if he tried to, some memory of them would come wafting into his brain and he’ll pull himself back again. Sure, the wounds on his heart burn less, but they don’t hesitate to bleed afresh whenever those blue eyes appear in his dreams.

He is still functioning like a robot, having lost all will to do anything. He just wakes up every day to go work so that he can pay his bills.

“Did… Avery, talk to you frequently?” he asks.

“Yeah, at least four times a week. We talked a lot. Why?”

“She never mentioned that she was going to kill herself? Or was, trying to?”

Monica frowned, sitting up on the bed. “No, Harry. On the contrary, I was pretty shocked when I came to know about the incident. It’s astonishing how she did not let me get a hint of what she was feeling. I was… stumped, when I heard.”

Harry’s brows furrow, reminiscing how broken she looked during her last days. “She was pretty evasive during that time,” his voice wavering a little.

“Harry, you don’t have to tell me right aw – “

“I caught her in the kitchen with a knife one day,” he says in one breath. Monica’s eyes widen in shock. “I just came back home from work, only to find her with that huge knife in her hand. She did not even look sad or scared. She looked focused; determined, even.” Harry’s voice becomes tight with emotion, him trying to gulp down the uneasy feeling spreading in his body at the grim memory.

“Babe?”

The knife dropped from her hand, Avery jumped and yelping lightly in fright. She had her back towards him, clutching her chest to calm down the sudden and sporadic heartbeat.

Harry was still taking everything in; he did not quite register the scene in front of him. This was not something he wanted to come home to tonight.

On the way here, he thought it would be a good idea to order Chinese from the local restaurant for dinner and later they’d share a bath. He had been worrying constantly about her schizophrenia over the past few weeks. Also, his job was the cherry on top of the cake for him.

A nice, relaxing time would be good for them, even if it lasts for a little bit.

So, surely, Harry was pretty much bowled over at the sight in front of him. If he’d arrived a minute later, God knew what he’d do and the thought was churning his stomach.

“What are you doing?” he says, his feet remain cemented on to the floor, not moving a single muscle since he arrived at the doorway of his house.

He looks at her face, which showed an expression of disdain. She looked annoyed and angry, frustrated even. His gaze shifts to the shiny blade peeking from the side of the counter, lying on the floor.

“Oh my – ,” Harry chokes on his words, everything clicking together in his brain.

“She even had the nerve to pick it up and try again,” he says. Her pained and desperate voice rings in Harry’s ears, yelling at him to let her kill herself and struggling to get out of his tight grip around her with  him trying his best to retract the knife from her hand.  

“I just couldn’t understand what was happening to her,” he says, his voice cracking between sobs. His face was red, a few tears trickling down his face. “What hurt her so bad that she even thought of killing herself? Wasn’t I enough? Weren’t all her friends and family enough?” He runs a hand through his face and hair, blowing out a gust of wind from his mouth, trying to calm himself. He shuts his eyes tiredly as he says, “Why would anybody want to do that to themselves?”

“Hey, hey,” Monica says. “Don’t blame yourself for what she did. Nobody should be blamed.”

“Of course someone, or, something, is to blame!” Harry exclaims in anger. “Do you think a person will voluntarily kill themselves? Was she in a mood that told her to kill herself?!” Harry is panting by the end of the sentence, now sitting upright on the couch.

“I did not mean to sound like that, Harry,” Monica sighs. Harry has gone past whatever he’s been restraining himself from. He was at his breaking point. Monica cannot imagine what it must have been like for him – to watch the person you love slowly die from within and then entirely.

“Look,” Monica tries again when all she hears are harsh breaths on the other end. “There must be something - if not someone - that must have motivated her. Can you think of any bad incident that happened to her?”

Harry has his head cradled in his palm, the other clutching his phone. He shakes his head, “No, not that I can think of. We’ve had our silly tiffs, had bad days at work. That’s it.”

“Oh,” Monica says, disappointed. “Well… I’m sorry, Harry.” She is genuinely sad for Harry. He is blaming himself for an incident that he is not responsible for.

When she doesn’t hear him for the next minute or two, she speaks up, “Hey, it’s – um - almost two in the morning… and tomorrow’s a Sunday!” she exclaims in realization. “Maybe, we can… meet up?”

Harry looks at the clock at her words, fingers wiping away the traces of his tears. “Uh, okay. Park?”

“The park it is, at ten? ” Monica smiles. Her voice shifts onto a more serious tone, “I know you’re really shaken up now, Harry. Don’t do anything stupid; Niall will report to me.”

“Ten is fine.” Harry says and hangs up.

He doesn’t know what just happened to him. Revisiting all those old memories had opened those wounds and dark chambers in his mind; her voice, her eyes, her tears, everything appearing before his eyes and a blurred image forms; messing with his lucidity.

And he hates the unbearable heartache that comes with it.

He looks at his phone and Monica’s words ring in his head: Don’t do anything stupid. They keep on blaring in his head, and his conscience fights to maintain its composure. A bottle of Jack Daniels awaits him on the counter, the amber colour luring him in.

Don’t do anything stupid.

He shakes his head as if to dismiss the voice, and grabs the bottle swiftly. The burning in his throat as he chugs down the liquid tells him that he is going to be okay, in a matter of time.

He’d stumbled into her apartment – Amanda was her name, was it? – half an hour later. She said she had been waiting for him, and easily welcomed him home, and into her body. He didn’t care about anything at that moment. He looked into her blue eyes and his throat choked up; he moved his head to her shoulders as he guided his body in and out of her. It was fast, messy, and empty.

When everything’s over and April is fast asleep beside him, he lays on her bed wide awake. The sickening feeling returns in his stomach as he looks at her, and Monica’s words ring again.

Don’t do anything stupid.

summary: Grey Area - Chapter 6
title: Grey Area - Chapter 6
body:
The link seems broken on my page?? I just realized I did not even upload the chap? Anyways, sorry to keep you waiting. (If anyone’s reading, that is.)


Tonight was one of the times Harry regretted having Niall as his best friend.

Not literally, but his rave and wild parties just ticked Harry off.  He stayed away from all of the commotion, in a secluded corner of the kitchen.

If Niall wasn’t his best friend, he’d been out of this party at lightning speed.

The lad is 24 now, and he still hosts parties like a teenager. There’s mad howling everywhere, two huge crates of booze on his kitchen counter, music thundering throughout the whole house and Harry is wondering how his poor neighbors are putting up with this madness.

They’re probably not going to talk to them anytime soon.

“I thought you left or something. I came here an hour ago and couldn’t find you anywhere.” Harry can barely hear through the music, but he can make out that that it was Monica who was talking to him.

“I don’t really like –“he stopped short when he turned around, getting a full view of her. She was dressed in a white sweater that was subtly accented with glitter and black pants, the tiniest bit of make – up on her face.  

She managed to look prettier than all the other women in his flat.

“Harry? You there?” she waved in front of his face, causing him to blink rapidly. Idiot, he mentally scolded himself. She was filling a glass of water for herself and offered Harry some, which he gladly accepted.

“You were saying something,” Monica said as she sipped from her glass.

“I just don’tlike parties, that’s all” He says, quickly chugging down the water and setting it down on the counter. People were irked by his dislike for parties because who doesn’t like parties today? Like, booze and people to sleep with for free, and he doesn’t want that?

“Oh, thank God, I was bloody suffocating in here. I absolutely detest parties, these kinds.” She pointed her finger towards the scene in front of them, swaying the glass in her clutch. “I mean, I was thinking he’d host a really small party, I didn’t even dress up properly,” she laughs, looking down at her outfit.

“Harry! Get off that bloody phone and look!” Avery yells from the bedroom and threw the cushion closest to her at him.

“What?” he exclaimed in annoyance, looking up at her.

He legit lost his breath when he took in what he saw. She was wearing a soft pink dress, hugging her body throughout.

“So?”

“You look so ravishing that I’m thinking of skipping that dinner and taking you right here,” he says, his eyes not blinking for a split second. He can see the same color rising in her cheeks, as she looked down.

“I’m not overdressed, am I? Is it too tight? Too revealing? I just really want your family to like me.”

“You’d look perfect even in a trash bag, love.” Harry chuckled, ending her rambling. He walked towards her and grasped her shoulders firmly, with a gentle touch. “You look beautiful, okay? And mum loves you anyways, so you don’t have to worry about that.” He presses a kiss to her lips.

Harry frowned at her words. She wasn’t dressed inappropriately. “You look just fine; half of the girls here have their chests spilling out.”

“Yeah, not a fan of that either.” She finishes her glass of water and sets it beside her on the counter. “I just don’t – wow, you have tattoos?” she immediately shifts closer to Harry, examining the anchor on the wrist. She’d always seen him dressed with full sleeves up till now. He was wearing one of his dress shirts with sleeves rolled up to his elbows.

“Can I?” she asks, looking up at him shyly. He knows that she doesn’t want to make it all awkward and go right in and touch the tattoos. He nods and Monica’s finger gently grips his wrist, before turning it around and noticing the other tattoos.

“A naked mermaid, seriously?”

He shrugged his shoulders nonchalantly. “What, I got it because I liked it. Don’t judge.” Monica looks at him for two seconds before raising her hands in surrender, stepping away from him.

“That girl’s been giving us quite the eye,” Monica says, turning around quickly. Confused, Harry scans the crowd for the said girl, and he finds her almost immediately; Emma. She’s scowling at them as if they were those nasty raccoons from his mum’s backyard.

“I shouldn’t have come to this party, I feel so uncomfortable.” Monica grimaces, looking back up at Harry. “I’ll just …leave,” she says to herself, before walking past Harry. He sees her squeezing her way through the crowd to collect her coat.

He stands there, blinking at the now empty spot at the door. He doesn’t know which silly nerve in him and what stupid chakra – Niall forced him to take yoga with him - in him compelled him to do so, because he quickly finds himself getting his own coat from the rack and hurtling through the door.

The hallway is empty, as he expected. He gets in the lift, tapping his foot in anticipation. He figures she’d be out of the complex by now, making him groan.

Sprinting out of the lift, he is out of the building’s door in a second. There are few people on the streets, a little chill that instantly makes him thrust his hands in his coat pockets. He looks around, twice; but he doesn’t find who he was looking for. He was dejectedly making his way back upstairs when a sparkly sweater caught his sight quite a distance away.

She’s dangerously tiny, he thinks as he hurriedly makes his way over to her. She’s walking at a moderate pace, so it was easy to catch up with her.

“Monica, wait – “

“Oh, my!” she screeches, ponytail whipping around as she turns around. She is visibly white and shook, and Harry curses himself for his timing. She takes a few seconds to recompose herself, a hand on her chest to steady her rapid heartbeat.

“I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you.”

“You better be,” she grumbles, looking up at him with disdain. “What are you doing here?”

“Why did you leave?”

“Because I didn’t like it there. I’ll apologize to Niall tomorrow, but I just couldn’t bear the loud music and all that drunken mess.”

“Okay,” Harry says, his throat closing in again. He realizes that this happens whenever Monica is around. “Do you, um – there’s a diner down the street, not very far from here.” Harry says the words so quickly he wonders if she’d been able to make out anything.

“You’re not going back?”

“No, not for some time at least,” he sighs. “Like you said, the music and drunken shit doesn’t fit me as well.” He manages a nervous smile.

Monica’s eyes widen, “Oh, okay. I guess I can use some food; didn’t have anything for three hours.”

They quietly make their way to the diner. Harry feels this unusual wash of peace around him, enjoying the leisurely stroll amidst the few people who were walking in the streets. He notices how short she really is, barely reaching up to his shoulders.

Monica’s insides are riveting with a sudden energy.

Her hands were sweating and her nerves were buzzing. Buzzing with what, she didn’t know. But it was the good kind of buzz. Harry led her to one of the booths in the diner, the typical kind and soft retro music thrumming away.

“Is it always this empty?”

“It’s Tuesday, so it’s not as crowded as it is during the weekends. It’s bloody impossible to breathe here at Sunday nights.” Harry says, slipping into the seat across from her.

To others in the diner, it would seem as if they were a couple who’d come here to have a quiet time for themselves. She’s not feeling anything for him – no, she’s not. But Harry’s actions are warming her insides because nobody really does nice things for her. She’s had near utter shitty relationships – the guy would only treat her to something if it was her birthday or something

Harry, on the other hand, was just being nice.

“Do you have anything in particular you want to order?”

“I’ll take whatever you’re taking. You’ve been here before, so I trust you with this,” she smirks, leaning back on the plush back of her seat. Harry scans the menu for a while before ordering two chicken burgers with fries.

It’s an easy silence between them. Normally, it would bug him out if it was this quiet between him and someone else. But with Monica, it’s easy. It feels good.

The two of them at a diner, retro music in the background, and a few cars in the background –Harry’s never felt this content in a long time.

“So, how’s work?” Monica quips after a while.

“It’s okay, I guess. The same thing every day.”

“Really? I thought a job at publishing was real good. All you do is read and get paid for.”

Her words elicit a small laugh from Harry. “It’s not just that. There’s an entire bunch of people even behind a 100 page book. Editing is only half of the work.”

“At least it’s better than working in a record store.” She says, taking a bite of from her fry. “And a suicide hotline, I guess.” She adds quietly.

Harry disagreed. “No, you help save lives there,” he says. “You have to give yourself some credit for that.”

She shakes her head, smiling wanly at him. “It’s not easy to listen to people telling you that they want to die time and again. They sound so broken and helpless on the phone, it’s very hard to maintain composure and get them to stop thinking about death,” she sighs. “It surprises me sometimes, you know? The amount of sad people around the world is just…”

Harry knows.

He knows what it is like.

He knows what it is like to deal with a person like that. He knows how it pains when you see them hurting, when you see them so weak you begin to think that they are actually dead, the frustration when they don’t listen to you and give in to their demons.

“Overwhelming.” Harry completes the sentence for her.

“I’m sorry I said that,” she shakes her head, waving her hand as if to dismiss the conversation.”Ruining the mood, and all.” She laughs. Her eyes are alight with warmth in them and Harry catches himself staring at them. A smile comes up on his face, a little overwhelmed by her beauty.

He knows she’s sympathetic to the people who call. She listens to these people every single day and yet she’s able to cheer up a person like him.

If anything, Harry accepts the fact that she’s stronger than him.

Tonight was one of the times Harry regretted having Niall as his best friend.

Not literally, but his rave and wild parties just ticked Harry off.  He stayed away from all of the commotion, in a secluded corner of the kitchen.

If Niall wasn’t his best friend, he’d been out of this party at lightning speed.

The lad is 24 now, and he still hosts parties like a teenager. There’s mad howling everywhere, two huge crates of booze on his kitchen counter, music thundering throughout the whole house and Harry is wondering how his poor neighbors are putting up with this madness.

They’re probably not going to talk to them anytime soon.

“I thought you left or something. I came here an hour ago and couldn’t find you anywhere.” Harry can barely hear through the music, but he can make out that that it was Monica who was talking to him.

“I don’t really like –“he stopped short when he turned around, getting a full view of her. She was dressed in a white sweater that was subtly accented with glitter and black pants, the tiniest bit of make – up on her face.  

She managed to look prettier than all the other women in his flat.

“Harry? You there?” she waved in front of his face, causing him to blink rapidly. Idiot, he mentally scolded himself. She was filling a glass of water for herself and offered Harry some, which he gladly accepted.

“You were saying something,” Monica said as she sipped from her glass.

“I just don’tlike parties, that’s all” He says, quickly chugging down the water and setting it down on the counter. People were irked by his dislike for parties because who doesn’t like parties today? Like, booze and people to sleep with for free, and he doesn’t want that?

“Oh, thank God, I was bloody suffocating in here. I absolutely detest parties, these kinds.” She pointed her finger towards the scene in front of them, swaying the glass in her clutch. “I mean, I was thinking he’d host a really small party, I didn’t even dress up properly,” she laughs, looking down at her outfit.

“Harry! Get off that bloody phone and look!” Avery yells from the bedroom and threw the cushion closest to her at him.

“What?” he exclaimed in annoyance, looking up at her.

He legit lost his breath when he took in what he saw. She was wearing a soft pink dress, hugging her body throughout.

“So?”

“You look so ravishing that I’m thinking of skipping that dinner and taking you right here,” he says, his eyes not blinking for a split second. He can see the same color rising in her cheeks, as she looked down.

“I’m not overdressed, am I? Is it too tight? Too revealing? I just really want your family to like me.”

“You’d look perfect even in a trash bag, love.” Harry chuckled, ending her rambling. He walked towards her and grasped her shoulders firmly, with a gentle touch. “You look beautiful, okay? And mum loves you anyways, so you don’t have to worry about that.” He presses a kiss to her lips.

Harry frowned at her words. She wasn’t dressed inappropriately. “You look just fine; half of the girls here have their chests spilling out.”

“Yeah, not a fan of that either.” She finishes her glass of water and sets it beside her on the counter. “I just don’t – wow, you have tattoos?” she immediately shifts closer to Harry, examining the anchor on the wrist. She’d always seen him dressed with full sleeves up till now. He was wearing one of his dress shirts with sleeves rolled up to his elbows.

“Can I?” she asks, looking up at him shyly. He knows that she doesn’t want to make it all awkward and go right in and touch the tattoos. He nods and Monica’s finger gently grips his wrist, before turning it around and noticing the other tattoos.

“A naked mermaid, seriously?”

He shrugged his shoulders nonchalantly. “What, I got it because I liked it. Don’t judge.” Monica looks at him for two seconds before raising her hands in surrender, stepping away from him.

“That girl’s been giving us quite the eye,” Monica says, turning around quickly. Confused, Harry scans the crowd for the said girl, and he finds her almost immediately; Emma. She’s scowling at them as if they were those nasty raccoons from his mum’s backyard.

“I shouldn’t have come to this party, I feel so uncomfortable.” Monica grimaces, looking back up at Harry. “I’ll just …leave,” she says to herself, before walking past Harry. He sees her squeezing her way through the crowd to collect her coat.

He stands there, blinking at the now empty spot at the door. He doesn’t know which silly nerve in him and what stupid chakra – Niall forced him to take yoga with him - in him compelled him to do so, because he quickly finds himself getting his own coat from the rack and hurtling through the door.

The hallway is empty, as he expected. He gets in the lift, tapping his foot in anticipation. He figures she’d be out of the complex by now, making him groan.

Sprinting out of the lift, he is out of the building’s door in a second. There are few people on the streets, a little chill that instantly makes him thrust his hands in his coat pockets. He looks around, twice; but he doesn’t find who he was looking for. He was dejectedly making his way back upstairs when a sparkly sweater caught his sight quite a distance away.

She’s dangerously tiny, he thinks as he hurriedly makes his way over to her. She’s walking at a moderate pace, so it was easy to catch up with her.

“Monica, wait – “

“Oh, my!” she screeches, ponytail whipping around as she turns around. She is visibly white and shook, and Harry curses himself for his timing. She takes a few seconds to recompose herself, a hand on her chest to steady her rapid heartbeat.

“I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you.”

“You better be,” she grumbles, looking up at him with disdain. “What are you doing here?”

“Why did you leave?”

“Because I didn’t like it there. I’ll apologize to Niall tomorrow, but I just couldn’t bear the loud music and all that drunken mess.”

“Okay,” Harry says, his throat closing in again. He realizes that this happens whenever Monica is around. “Do you, um – there’s a diner down the street, not very far from here.” Harry says the words so quickly he wonders if she’d been able to make out anything.

“You’re not going back?”

“No, not for some time at least,” he sighs. “Like you said, the music and drunken shit doesn’t fit me as well.” He manages a nervous smile.

Monica’s eyes widen, “Oh, okay. I guess I can use some food; didn’t have anything for three hours.”

They quietly make their way to the diner. Harry feels this unusual wash of peace around him, enjoying the leisurely stroll amidst the few people who were walking in the streets. He notices how short she really is, barely reaching up to his shoulders.

Monica’s insides are riveting with a sudden energy.

Her hands were sweating and her nerves were buzzing. Buzzing with what, she didn’t know. But it was the good kind of buzz. Harry led her to one of the booths in the diner, the typical kind and soft retro music thrumming away.

“Is it always this empty?”

“It’s Tuesday, so it’s not as crowded as it is during the weekends. It’s bloody impossible to breathe here at Sunday nights.” Harry says, slipping into the seat across from her.

To others in the diner, it would seem as if they were a couple who’d come here to have a quiet time for themselves. She’s not feeling anything for him – no, she’s not. But Harry’s actions are warming her insides because nobody really does nice things for her. She’s had near utter shitty relationships – the guy would only treat her to something if it was her birthday or something

Harry, on the other hand, was just being nice.

“Do you have anything in particular you want to order?”

“I’ll take whatever you’re taking. You’ve been here before, so I trust you with this,” she smirks, leaning back on the plush back of her seat. Harry scans the menu for a while before ordering two chicken burgers with fries.

It’s an easy silence between them. Normally, it would bug him out if it was this quiet between him and someone else. But with Monica, it’s easy. It feels good.

The two of them at a diner, retro music in the background, and a few cars in the background –Harry’s never felt this content in a long time.

“So, how’s work?” Monica quips after a while.

“It’s okay, I guess. The same thing every day.”

“Really? I thought a job at publishing was real good. All you do is read and get paid for.”

Her words elicit a small laugh from Harry. “It’s not just that. There’s an entire bunch of people even behind a 100 page book. Editing is only half of the work.”

“At least it’s better than working in a record store.” She says, taking a bite of from her fry. “And a suicide hotline, I guess.” She adds quietly.

Harry disagreed. “No, you help save lives there,” he says. “You have to give yourself some credit for that.”

She shakes her head, smiling wanly at him. “It’s not easy to listen to people telling you that they want to die time and again. They sound so broken and helpless on the phone, it’s very hard to maintain composure and get them to stop thinking about death,” she sighs. “It surprises me sometimes, you know? The amount of sad people around the world is just…”

Harry knows.

He knows what it is like.

He knows what it is like to deal with a person like that. He knows how it pains when you see them hurting, when you see them so weak you begin to think that they are actually dead, the frustration when they don’t listen to you and give in to their demons.

“Overwhelming.” Harry completes the sentence for her.

“I’m sorry I said that,” she shakes her head, waving her hand as if to dismiss the conversation.”Ruining the mood, and all.” She laughs. Her eyes are alight with warmth in them and Harry catches himself staring at them. A smile comes up on his face, a little overwhelmed by her beauty.

He knows she’s sympathetic to the people who call. She listens to these people every single day and yet she’s able to cheer up a person like him.

If anything, Harry accepts the fact that she’s stronger than him.

She shakes her head, smiling wanly at him. “It’s not easy to listen to people telling you that they want to die time and again. They sound so broken and helpless on the phone, it’s very hard to maintain composure and get them to stop thinking about death,” she sighs. “It surprises me sometimes, you know? The amount of sad people around the world is just…”

Harry knows.

He knows what it is like.

He knows what it is like to deal with a person like that. He knows how it pains when you see them hurting, when you see them so weak you begin to think that they are actually dead, the frustration when they don’t listen to you and give in to their demons.

“Overwhelming.” Harry completes the sentence for her.

“I’m sorry I said that,” she shakes her head, waving her hand as if to dismiss the conversation.”Ruining the mood, and all.” She laughs. Her eyes are alight with warmth in them and Harry catches himself staring at them. A smile comes up on his face, a little overwhelmed by her beauty.

He knows she’s sympathetic to the people who call. She listens to these people every single day and yet she’s able to cheer up a person like him.

If anything, Harry accepts the fact that she’s stronger than him.

-
